intro: Dasystephana cruciata, commonly known as the crucifix starling or crucifix star. It is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers, which are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The botanical features of Dasystephana cruciata make it a notable species in the Asteraceae family.
